task.title: Disable FirewallD on RHEL 7
task.shortdesc: This topic describes how to stop and disable FirewallD on RHEL 7.

ul.li: You should have successfully installed RHEL 7 before this task.

taskbody.context:
If you have existing firewall rules on your host machines, you must disable the firewall in order to install . You should re-enable it after installation.
The firewall on a RHEL 7 system is enabled by default. However, FirewallD is not compatible with . After you upgrade to RHEL 7, and before you restart the CLC, you must disable the firewalld service on all host machines.
For more information, see FirewallD on RHEL 7 or FirewallD on CentOS. To stop and disable FirewallD
